abstract: Florida Senate passes bill that will reform law governing capital punishment sentencing in state and will allow resumption of death penalty prosecutions, although it will become more difficult for juries to hand down death sentences; bill, which addresses concerns of Supreme Court ruling striking down  state's capital punishment law, is likely to be signed by Gov Rick Scott.

headline.print_headline: Florida Senate Backs Bill Making It Harder for Juries to Sentence Someone to Die
headline.main: Florida Revamps Death Penalty, Making It Harder to Sentence Someone to Die

snippet: The new legislation grew out a Supreme Court order saying jurors did not have enough say in whether someone was put to death for committing a crime.
lead_paragraph: The new legislation grew out a Supreme Court order saying jurors did not have enough say in whether someone was put to death for committing a crime.
